text: we're looking for a quick dip recipe
everybody always is right today's recipe
is kind of fun it's an avocado and
jicama dip I don't know if you've ever
seen jicama but it's a tuberous root and
it's got a really great texture it's
sort of juicy and crispy and a little
bit sweet it's kind of hard to describe
if you've never had it but if you see it
in the store pick it up and you can make
this dip or you can just cut it up and
eat it as a snack it's really good putt
up re avocados I'm just cutting mine
right here in the skin the way I
normally do and get them into a bowl you
want to make sure they're nice and ripe
otherwise this is more of a salad than a
dip I like to buy my avocados unripe
about three days before I want to serve
them and then let them ripen on my
counter I find that I have better luck
with them that way then buying them when
they're almost right because people
touch them and squeeze them in the store
to see if they're ripe then they get
bruises so if you buy the really hard
ones you'll avoid that peel your jicama
it's got a nice thin skin it almost has
skin the texture of ginger doesn't taste
anything like ginger though it's coming
off in big strips peeled then cut your
jicama in small pieces about the same
size as the avocado that can go into the
bowl with the avocado then for some
flavoring for scallions thinly sliced I
like the mild flavor of the scallion
here I wouldn't want to replace it with
anything else you could use it just a
tiny bit of garlic if you wanted to but
not too much because it can be
overpowering and then some lime juice
about a quarter of a cup and I love the
smell of limes when they're squeezing is
probably about two tablespoons stir
together season with some salt and
pepper
and then stir you want everything fully
combined and you can mash up some of the
avocado and leave some pieces a little
bit chunky and this is definitely enough
for a party all right now for the fun
part the tasting see if it has the right
seasoning you can see that it's sort of
coated in everything but it's still very
chunky which is nice and you're going to
get a bright fresh flavor from the
jicama a little bit tangy little bit
creamy it's like a really fun take on
guacamole give it a try
you
